ADRIAN:
Adrian is cool ...
 but Charlie is cooler ;)
THE GEEK:
![Adrian](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/Adrian_profile.png)
 Adrian after building a 3D printer.
 Adrian really enjoys discovering new technologies!
 Here a list of cool projects he has worked on: %[Kilobots](postback:Kilobots) %[Self driving cars](postback:Self_Driving_Cars) %[Chatbots](postback:Chatbots)
ANOTHER GEEK PROJECT: Which project would you like to explore: %[Kilobots](postback:Kilobots) %[Self driving cars](postback:Self_Driving_Cars) %[Chatbots](postback:Chatbots)
KILOBOTS:
This is a Kilobot!
![SingleKilobot](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/single_kilobot.jpg)
 One of the simplest/cheapest robots in the world.
 The Kilobot was designed by the Self-organizing Systems Research Lab at Harvard where Adrian conducted his Master thesis.
 Kilobots are the largest swarm of robots in the world.
![SwarmKilobot](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/kilobot-swarm.jpg)
 Adrian focused in collective transport, having kilobots work together to move objects they could not move alone.
 Here a video of kilobots collectively stealing a picnic basket:
![Picnic](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/kilobot.gif)
 Aren't they cool!
 %[Another geek project](postback:Another_geek_project) %[Another facet](postback:Another_facet)
SELF DRIVING CARS:
Adrian conducted research on self driving cars at the Distributed Intelligent Systems and Algorithms Laboratory at EPFL.
 His research focused on creating algorithms to avoid collisions. %[Another geek project](postback:Another_geek_project) %[Another facet](postback:Another_facet)

BMX:
Adrian participated in two world championships (Brazil 2006 and Canada 2007) representing his home country Bolivia.
 ![BMX](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/bmx.jpg)
 Jumping over 30 ft jumps while battling with 7 other riders doesn't look that easy :$
 %[Another sport](postback:Another_sport) %[Another facet](postback:Another_facet)
SNOWBOARDING:
Since he moved to Switzerland, Adrian has spent most of his winter holidays snowboarding in the Alps.
 ![SNOWBOARD](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/snowboard_rafa.jpg)
 Ok, Ok, that's not Adrian. It's his brother Rafael.
 %[Another sport](postback:Another_sport) %[Another facet](postback:Another_facet)
KITESURFING:
The most recent sport Adrian has gotten into is Kitesurfing. The speed and adrenaline provided by the wind are fantastic!
 ![KITESURFING](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/kitesurfing2.jpg)
 At the moment. Adrian spends more time drinking seawater than on his board :P %[Another sport](postback:Another_sport) %[Another facet](postback:Another_facet)
THE BUSINESS MAN:
Adrian has had the opportunity to work in several companies!
 Would you like to learn more about his professional experience: %[IBM](postback:IBM) %[DUPONT](postback:DUPONT) %[BCG](postback:BCG)
ANOTHER JOB: Which job would you like to know more about: %[IBM](postback:IBM) %[DUPONT](postback:DUPONT) %[BCG](postback:BCG)
IBM:
![IBMLOGO](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/ibmlogo.jpg)
 Adrian joined IBM's Work-student program. Where he worked part time (50%) at IBM next to his studies.
 During his time at IBM he held two positions:
 His first role was in the competency development and education team.
 He then moved to the IT security team where he performed IT automation for banking servers.
 %[Another job](postback:Another_job) %[Another facet](postback:Another_facet)
DUPONT:
![DUPONTLOGO](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/dupontlogo.jpg)
 After graduating from EPFL, Adrian joined DuPont's European Operations Graduate Program
 The program consisted in 3 rotations of 2 years in different manufacturing plants.
 The goal of the program was to create the next generation of plant managers.
![DuPontUniform](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/dupont_uniform.jpg)
 %[Another job](postback:Another_job) %[Another facet](postback:Another_facet)
BCG:
![BCGLOGO](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/adidibmx/EstherBot/master/img/bcglogo.jpg)
 At the Boston Consulting Group, Adrian has had the opportunity to experience various industries, develop solutions in different expertise areas and gain international exposure by working in different countries.
 %[Another job](postback:Another_job) %[Another facet](postback:Another_facet)
THE GLOBETROTTER:
Adrian is half Bolivian and half Spanish.
 He has lived in four countries: Bolivia, Switzerland, the U.S. and France, nine cities, twenty houses and attended nine different schools.
 Adrian has moved a lot :) 
 Here some adventure I think you might enjoy

EDUCATION:
Adrian has studied in 9 different schools throughout his life.
 In three different countries: Bolivia, the U.S. and Switzerland
 Would you like to know more about his: %[High school](postback:High_school) %[Bachelors degree](postback:Bachelors_degree) %[Masters degree](postback:Masters_degree) %[Extracurricular activities](postback:Extracurricular_activities)
HIGH SCHOOL:
Adrian has studied in two different high schools.
 He attended a French school in Bolivia during his freshman and sophomore years.
 After this he attended Freedom high school in Tampa, Fl for his junior and senior year. 
 Would you like to know what he did next? %[Bachelors degree](postback:Bachelors_degree) %[Masters degree](postback:Masters_degree)
BACHELORS DEGREE:
Adrian decided he wanted to not only explore a new field of studies but also a new country.
 He attended the Swiss Institute of Technology in Lausanne (EPFL in French)
 Where he earned his Bachelor degree in MicroEngineering.
 Would you be interested in learning more about:
 %[EPFL](postback:EPFL) %[Microengineering](postback:Microengineering)%[Masters degree](postback:Masters_degree)
EPFL: EPFL is Europeâ€™s most cosmopolitan technical university with students, professors and staff from over 120 nations. A dynamic environment, open to Switzerland and the world, EPFL is centered on its three missions: teaching, research and technology transfer. EPFL works together with an extensive network of partners including other universities and institutes of technology, developing and emerging countries, secondary schools and colleges, industry and economy, political circles and the general public, to bring about real impact for society./n More: %[Education](postback:Education) %[Professional Experience](postback:Professional_Experience) %[Campus Tour](http://virtualtour.epfl.ch/#!/) %[Hobbies and interests](postback:Hobbies_interests)

 He conducted research on collective transport with kilobots.
